item.title: Steve add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Some people never go crazy. What truly horrible lives they must lead." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Steve add a quote by Mortimer J. Adler
item.description: "In the case of good books, the point is not to see how many of them you can get through, but rather how many can get through to you." -- Mortimer J. Adler

item.title: Steve add a quote by Philip Roth
item.description: "Everybody else is working to change, persuade, tempt and control them. The best readers come to fiction to be free of all that noise." -- Philip Roth

item.title: Steve add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies, said Jojen. The man who never reads lives only one." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Steve add a quote by Derek Walcott
item.description: "The time will come when, with elation, you will greet yourself arriving at your own door, in your own mirror, and each will smile at the other’s welcome." -- Derek Walcott

item.title: Steve add a quote by Lillian Hellman
item.description: "I cannot and will not cut my conscience to fit this year's fashions." -- Lillian Hellman

item.title: Steve add a quote by Barbara Taylor Bradford
item.description: "We are each the authors of our own lives, Emma. We live in what we have created. There is no way to shift the blame and no one else to accept the accolades." -- Barbara Taylor Bradford

item.title: Steve add a quote by Rachel Carson
item.description: "The more clearly we can focus our attention on the wonders and realities of the universe about us, the less taste we shall have for destruction." -- Rachel Carson

item.title: Steve add a quote by Lucille Clifton
item.description: "may you kiss the wind then turn from it certain that it will love your back" -- Lucille Clifton

item.title: Steve add a quote by Elisabeth Kübler-Ross
item.description: "Should you shield the canyons from the windstorms you would never see the true beauty of their carvings." -- Elisabeth Kübler-Ross

item.title: Steve add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Heaven goes by favor. If it went by merit, you would stay out and your dog would go in." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Steve add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "Once there was a tree, and she loved a little boy." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Steve add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "None of us really changes over time. We only become more fully what we are." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Steve add a quote by Caroline Gordon
item.description: "A well-composed book is a magic carpet on which we are wafted to a world that we cannot enter in any other way." -- Caroline Gordon

item.title: Steve add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Eating and reading are two pleasures that combine admirably." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Steve add a quote by Chris Abani
item.description: "What I've come to learn is that the world is never saved in grand messianic gestures, but in the simple accumulation of gentle, soft, almost invisible acts of compassion." -- Chris Abani

item.title: Steve add a quote by Louise Erdrich
item.description: "When we are young, the words are scattered all around us. As they are assembled by experience, so also are we, sentence by sentence, until the story takes shape." -- Louise Erdrich

item.title: Steve add a quote by Jhumpa Lahiri
item.description: "That's the thing about books. They let you travel without moving your feet." -- Jhumpa Lahiri
